column5: There was another thread looking for nice accomodations in Canada. I want to go with my FIL and BIL next summer, but all the locations in that thread were mostly accessable from Minnesota - I'm in Michigan. Does anyone have a list of suggestions further east and easier to access from Michigan? The only decent one I've been able to locate is Pine Portage Lodge. Thanks, Dave

I'm super familiar with that region. The easy answer for me is Lodge 88 on Esnagi Lake. I was there with my family last August and that facility is something special.http://www.canadafishingguide.net/th...-eighty-eight/

The Wilderness North Lodges, Smoothrock Camp and Marmac Lodge seem relatively nice to me. There's also Esnagami Wilderness Lodge.There's several places out of Hornepayne that I think are quite nice as well, such as Expeditions North, KayVee Lodge, Agich's Kaby Kabins, Leuenberger's Kag Lodge and Buck & Bingwood. I also like the boat-in lodges on Lady Evelyn Lake - Island 10 and Garden Island Lodge.It depends on what you are looking for. How nice is nice to you?

Electricity, showers (could be in a separate building), decent boat/motor, quality breakfast and dinner, shore lunch kit. Friendly people, good fishing, queen bed (I'm tall). that's pretty much it. Thanks.

I've been to Esnagami Wilderness lodge and they have everything your looking for. Don't know about the queen size bed but I would ask. 18 ft cedar boats, great food and staff. Good walleye and pike fishing. Eric and his wife Sue have a very nice lodge there. I haven't been to Lodge 88 but I really liked Mike's video and report on it. Really looks like a nice place. It's on my to go list.
